alert.note: Alert for Custer; Garfield; Loup (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 12:55PM CDT until July 07 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Nebraska and north central Nebraska, including the following counties, in central Nebraska, Custer. In north central Nebraska, Garfield and Loup. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1255 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Taylor, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Horseshoe Bend Lake, Hannamon Bayou Campground, Almeria, Valley View Flat Campground and Nunda Shoal Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
